sn46.1:1.2: “Mendicants, dragons grow and wax strong supported by the Himalayas, the king of mountains.
sn46.1:1.3: When they’re strong they dive into the pools. Then they dive into the lakes, the streams, the rivers, and finally the ocean. There they acquire a great and abundant body.
sn46.1:1.4: In the same way, a mendicant develops and cultivates the seven awakening factors depending on and grounded on ethics, acquiring great and abundant good qualities.
sn46.1:1.5: And how does a mendicant develop the seven awakening factors depending on and grounded on ethics, acquiring great and abundant good qualities?
sn46.1:1.6: It’s when a mendicant develops the awakening factor of mindfulness, which relies on seclusion, fading away, and cessation, and ripens as letting go.
sn46.1:1.7: They develop the awakening factor of investigation of principles …
sn46.1:1.8: They develop the awakening factor of energy …
sn46.1:1.9: They develop the awakening factor of rapture …
sn46.1:1.10: They develop the awakening factor of tranquility …
sn46.1:1.11: They develop the awakening factor of immersion …
sn46.1:1.12: They develop the awakening factor of equanimity, which relies on seclusion, fading away, and cessation, and ripens as letting go.
sn46.1:1.13: That’s how a mendicant develops and cultivates the seven awakening factors depending on and grounded on ethics, acquiring great and abundant good qualities.”
